title: Product Manager Interview Guide
description: Navigate product sense, execution, and leadership questions.

content.text: These videos cover key techniques and real examples to help you prepare for Product Manager interviews.

PM interviews assess your ability to identify user problems, prioritize ruthlessly, work cross-functionally, and drive results. You'll face product design questions, metrics/analysis, strategy, and behavioral rounds.

**What interviewers assess:**

- Product sense and user empathy
- Analytical thinking and metrics intuition
- Prioritization and trade-off decisions
- Communication and influence without authority
- Technical understanding (varies by company)

**Typical PM interview loop:**

1. **Recruiter screen** (30 min)
2. **Hiring manager screen** (45-60 min) - Background, role fit
3. **Onsite/Virtual loop** (4-5 hours):
   - Product sense/design round
   - Analytical/metrics round
   - Strategy/estimation round
   - Behavioral/leadership round
   - Technical (some companies)
Always start product questions by clarifying the user and their goals. Jumping to solutions without understanding the problem is a red flag.

items.text: User-centric thinking - Start with user needs
Prioritization - Say no to good ideas for great ones
Metrics definition - Know how to measure success
Technical communication - Translate between business and engineering
Practice product design questions (improve X, design Y for Z)
Prepare metrics for common products (social, e-commerce, etc.)
Review estimation techniques for market sizing
Prepare STAR stories showing leadership and influence
Read Cracking the PM Interview or Decode and Conquer
